channel.title: Fink on Fink broker
channel.description: Recent content in Fink on Fink broker

item.title: Joining Fink
item.description: If you want to know more about Fink and our recent releases and science results, you can follow us on twitter @FinkBroker and check our news. You can join the Fink collaboration by filling this form. You will be then subscribed to our mailing list and receive relevant news and information about our general meetings. You can also submit a Fink community project if you have already something in mind. You don’t need a community project to join Fink.

item.title: Publications
item.description: List of publications from the Fink collaboration and the larger astronomy community that uses Fink public data. 2022 Impact of satellite glints on the transient science on ZTF scale, Sergey Karpov, Julien Peloton Fink: early supernovae Ia classification using active learning, Marco Leoni, Emille E. O. Ishida, Julien Peloton, Anais Möller 2021 Fink, a new generation of broker for the LSST community, Anais Möller, Julien Peloton, Emille E.

item.title: Team
item.description: Management Team Emille E. O. Ishida (PI) - CNRS/LPC Clermont, IT department Anais Möller (PI) - Swinburne University, Centre for Astrophysics and Supercomputing Julien Peloton (PI) - CNRS/IJCLab, IT department You can contact us at contact(at)fink-broker.org for more information. Development Team Julien Peloton (Lead) - CNRS/IJCLab, IT department Julius Hrivnac (database) - CNRS/IJCLab, IT department Marco Leoni (machine learning) - Université Paris-Saclay, IT department Adrien Ramparison (cloud management, deployment, monitoring) - CNRS/IJCLab, IT department Fink members & collaborators Czech Republic CEICO, Institute of Physics, Czech Academy of Sciences: S.
